text: Dear Theophilus, in my first writings I wrote about all the things Jesus did and taught from the beginning
speaker: Narrator

text: until the day He went to heaven. He spoke to the missionaries through the Holy Spirit. He told those whom He had chosen what they should do.
speaker: Narrator

text: After He had suffered much and then died, He showed Himself alive in many sure ways for forty days. He told them many things about the holy nation of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they were gathered together with Him, He told them, “Do not leave Jerusalem. Wait for what the Father has promised. You heard Me speak of this.
speaker: Narrator

text: For John the Baptist baptized with water but in a few days you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who were with Him asked, “Lord, is this the time for You to give the nation back to the Jews?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “It is not for you to know the special days or the special times which the Father has put in His own power.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes into your life. You will tell about Me in the city of Jerusalem and over all the countries of Judea and Samaria and to the ends of the earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus had said this and while they were still looking at Him, He was taken up. A cloud carried Him away so they could not see Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were still looking up to heaven, watching Him go. All at once two men dressed in white stood beside them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “You men of the country of Galilee, why do you stand looking up into heaven? This same Jesus Who was taken from you into heaven will return in the same way you saw Him go up into heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The followers went back to Jerusalem from the Mount of Olives, which is close to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came into the city, they went up to a room on the second floor where they stayed. The followers were Peter and John, James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus, Simon the Canaanite, and Judas the brother of James.
speaker: Narrator

text: These all agreed as they prayed together. The women and Mary the mother of Jesus and His brothers were there.
speaker: Narrator

text: On one of those days Peter got up in front of the followers. (There were about 120 people there.) He said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Men and brothers, it happened as the Holy Writings said it would happen which the Holy Spirit spoke through David. They told about Judas who would hand Jesus over to those who wanted to take Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Judas was one of our group and had a part in our work.
speaker: Narrator

text: This man bought a field with the money he received for his sin. And falling down head first, his body broke open and his insides ran out.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the people of Jerusalem knew about this. They called the place Field of Blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it is written in the Book of Psalms, ‘Let his place of living be empty and let no one live there,’ and, ‘Let another person take over his work.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “The man to take the place of Judas should be one of these men who walked along with us when the Lord Jesus was with us.
speaker: Narrator

text: He must have been with Jesus from the day He was baptized by John to the day He was taken up from us. So one of these should be added to our group who will tell others that he saw Jesus raised from the dead.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought two men in front of them. They were Joseph, also called Barsabbas Justus, and Matthias.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the followers prayed, saying, “Lord, You know the hearts of all men. Show us which of these two men You have chosen.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is to take the place of Judas in this work and be a missionary. Judas lost his place and went where he belonged because of sin.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they drew names and the name of Matthias was chosen. He became one with the eleven missionaries.
speaker: Narrator

text: The followers of Jesus were all together in one place fifty days after the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: All at once there was a sound from heaven like a powerful wind. It filled the house where they were sitting.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they saw tongues which were divided that looked like fire. These came down on each one of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were all filled with the Holy Spirit. Then they began to speak in other languages which the Holy Spirit made them able to speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were many religious Jews staying in Jerusalem. They were from every country of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard this strange sound, they gathered together. They all listened! It was hard for them to believe they were hearing words in their own language.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were surprised and wondered about it. They said to each other, “Are not these Galileans who are speaking?
speaker: Narrator

text: How is it that each one of us can hear his own language?
speaker: Narrator

text: We are Parthians and Medes, Elamites and from the countries of Mesopotamia, Judea and Cappadocia, Pontus and in the countries of Asia,
speaker: Narrator

text: Phrygia and Pamphylia, Egypt and the parts of Libya near Cyrene. Some have come from the city of Rome. Some are Jews by birth and others have become Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some are also men of the countries of Crete and Arabia. They are speaking of the powerful works of God to all of us in our own language!”
speaker: Narrator

text: They were all surprised and wondered about this. They said to each other, “What can this mean?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But others laughed and made fun, saying, “These men are full of new wine.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter stood up with the eleven missionaries and spoke with a loud voice, “Men of the country of Judea and all of you who are living in Jerusalem, I want you to know what is happening. So listen to what I am going to say.
speaker: Narrator

text: These men are not drunk as you think. It is only nine o’clock in the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text: The early preacher Joel said this would happen.
speaker: Narrator

text: God says, ‘In the last days I will send My Spirit on all men. Then your sons and daughters will speak God’s Word. Your young men will see what God has given them to see. Your old men will dream dreams.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yes, on those I own, both men and women, I will send My Spirit in those days. They will speak God’s Word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will show powerful works in the sky above. There will be things to see in the earth below like blood and fire and clouds of smoke.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sun will turn dark and the moon will turn to blood before the day of the Lord. His coming will be a great and special day.
speaker: Narrator

text: It will be that whoever calls on the name of the Lord will be saved from the punishment of sin.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Jewish men, listen to what I have to say! You knew Jesus of the town of Nazareth by the powerful works He did. God worked through Jesus while He was with you. You all know this.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus was handed over to sinful men. God knew this and planned for it to happen. You had sinful men take Him and nail Him to a cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God raised Him up. He allowed Him to be set free from the pain of death. Death could not hold its power over Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “David said this about Him, ‘I can see the Lord before me all the time. He is at my right side so that I do not need to be troubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am glad and my tongue is full of joy. My body rests in hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will not leave my soul in death. You will not allow Your Holy One to be destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have shown me the ways of life. I will be full of joy when I see Your face.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Brothers, I can tell you in plain words that our early father David not only died but was buried. We know where his grave is today.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was one who spoke for God. He knew God had made a promise to him. From his family Christ would come and take His place as King.
speaker: Narrator

text: He knew this before and spoke of Christ being raised from the dead. Christ’s soul would not be left in hell. His body would not be destroyed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus is this One! God has raised Him up and we have all seen Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “This Jesus has been lifted up to God’s right side. The Holy Spirit was promised by the Father. God has given Him to us. That is what you are seeing and hearing now!
speaker: Narrator

text: It was not David who was taken up to heaven, because he said, ‘The Lord said to my Lord, “Sit at My right side,
speaker: Narrator

text: for those who hate You will be a place to rest Your feet.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: The whole Jewish nation must know for sure that God has made this Jesus, both Lord and Christ. He is the One you nailed to a cross!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Jews heard this, their hearts were troubled. They said to Peter and to the other missionaries, “Brothers, what should we do?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to them, “Be sorry for your sins and turn from them and be baptized in the name of Jesus Christ, and your sins will be forgiven. You will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: This promise is to you and your children. It is to all people everywhere. It is to as many as the Lord our God will call.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said many other things. He helped them understand that they should keep themselves from the sinful people of this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who believed what he said were baptized. There were about 3,000 more followers added that day.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were faithful in listening to the teaching of the missionaries. They worshiped and prayed and ate the Lord’s supper together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many powerful works were done by the missionaries. Surprise and fear came on them all.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those who put their trust in Christ were together and shared what they owned.
speaker: Narrator

text: As anyone had need, they sold what they owned and shared with everyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Day after day they went to the house of God together. In their houses they ate their food together. Their hearts were happy.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave thanks to God and all the people respected them. The Lord added to the group each day those who were being saved from the punishment of sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter and John were going to the house of God about three o’clock. It was the time for prayer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each day a certain man was carried to the Beautiful Gate of the house of God. This man had never been able to walk. He was there begging for money from those who were going in.
speaker: Narrator

text: He asked Peter and John for money when he saw them going in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter and John looked at him. Then Peter said, “Look at us!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The man who could not walk looked at them. He thought he would get something from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said, “I have no money, but what I have I will give you! In the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, get up and walk!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter took the man by the right hand and lifted him up. At once his feet and the bones in his legs became strong.
speaker: Narrator

text: He jumped up on his feet and walked. Then he went into the house of God with them. He gave thanks to God as he walked.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the people saw him walking and giving thanks to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: They knew it was the man who had been sitting and begging at the Beautiful Gate. They were surprised he was walking.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man who was healed held on to Peter and John. All the people who were surprised gathered together around them in a place called Solomon’s Porch.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter saw this, he said to them, “Jewish men, why are you surprised at this? Why do you look at us as if we had made this man walk by our own power or holy lives?
speaker: Narrator

text: The God of our fathers, the God of Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, has done this. He has honored His Son Jesus. He is the One you handed over to Pilate. You turned your backs on Him after Pilate had decided to let Him go free.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you turned your backs against the Holy and Right One. Then you asked for a man who had killed someone to go free.
speaker: Narrator

text: You killed the very One Who made all life. But God raised Him from the dead. We saw Him alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: You see and know this man here. He has been made strong through faith in Jesus’ name. Yes, it is faith in Christ that has made this man well and strong. This man is standing here in front of you all.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Brothers, I know you and your leaders did this without knowing what you were doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this way, God did what He said He would do through all the early preachers. He said that Christ must suffer many hard things.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you must be sorry for your sins and turn from them. You must turn to God and have your sins taken away. Then many times your soul will receive new strength from the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will send Jesus back to the world. He is the Christ Who long ago was chosen for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But for awhile He must stay in heaven until the time when all things are made right. God said these things would happen through His holy early preachers.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Moses said, ‘The Lord God will raise up from among your brothers One Who speaks for God, as He raised me. You must listen to everything He says.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone among the people who will not listen to that One Who speaks for God will be put to death.’
speaker: Narrator

text: All the early preachers who have spoken from Samuel until now have told of these days.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are of the family of the early preachers and of the promise that God made with our early fathers. He said to Abraham, ‘All the families of the earth will receive God’s favor through your children.’
speaker: Narrator

text: God has raised up His Son Jesus and has sent Him to you first to give God’s favor to each of you who will turn away from his sinful ways.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The religious leaders and the leader of the house of God and some of the religious group who believe no one will be raised from the dead came to Peter and John while they were talking to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were angry because Peter and John had been teaching the people and preaching that Jesus had been raised from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they took them and put them in prison until the next day because it was evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: But many of those who heard what Peter and John said put their trust in Christ. The group of followers was now about 5,000 men.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day the leaders of the court and the leaders of the people and the teachers of the Law came together in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Annas the head religious leader was there. Caiaphas and John and Alexander were there also and all who were in the family of the head religious leader.
speaker: Narrator

text: They put the missionaries in front of them and asked, “By what power or in whose name have you done this?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter, having been filled with the Holy Spirit, said, “You who are leaders of the people,
speaker: Narrator

text: are you asking us today about the good work we did to a man who needed help? Are you asking how he was healed?
speaker: Narrator

text: You and all the Jews must know that it was by the name of Jesus Christ of Nazareth, the One you nailed to a cross and God raised from the dead. It is through Him that this man stands in front of you well and strong.
speaker: Narrator

text: Christ is the Stone that was put aside by you workmen. But He has become the most important Stone in the building.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is no way to be saved from the punishment of sin through anyone else. For there is no other name under heaven given to men by which we can be saved.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They were surprised and wondered how easy it was for Peter and John to speak. They could tell they were men who had not gone to school. But they knew they had been with Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were not able to argue about what Peter and John had said because the man who had been healed was standing with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The religious leaders told Peter and John to leave the court so the leaders could talk together.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “What should we do with these men? Everyone living in Jerusalem knows a powerful work has been done by them. We cannot say that it did not happen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let us tell them with strong words that they must not speak again to anyone in this name. This will keep the news from going out among the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they called them in and told them they must not speak or teach anymore in the name of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter and John said, “If it is right to listen to you more than to God, you decide about that.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we must tell what we have seen and heard.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After they had spoken more sharp words to them, they let them go. They could not beat them because the people were giving thanks to God for what had happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man on whom this powerful work of healing had been done was more than forty years old.
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as the missionaries were free to go, they went back to their own group. They told them everything the religious leaders had said.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard it, they all prayed to God, saying, “Lord God, You made the heaven and the earth and the sea and everything that is in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: You said through the Holy Spirit by the mouth of our father David, ‘Why are the nations so shaken up and the people planning foolish things?
speaker: Narrator

text: The kings of the earth stood in a line ready to fight, and the leaders were all against the Lord and against His Christ.’
speaker: Narrator

text: You know that Herod and Pilate and the Jews and the people who are not Jews gathered together here against Jesus. He was Your Holy Son and the One You had chosen
speaker: Narrator

text: to do everything You planned and said would happen.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, Lord, listen to their sharp words. Make it easy for your servants to preach Your Word with power.
speaker: Narrator

text: May You heal and do powerful works and special things to see through the name of Jesus, Your Holy Son!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had finished praying, the place where they were gathered was shaken. They were all filled with the Holy Spirit. It was easy for them to speak the Word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: The many followers acted and thought the same way. None of them said that any of their things were their own, but they shared all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: The missionaries told with much power how Jesus was raised from the dead. God’s favor was on them all.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one was in need. All who owned houses or pieces of land sold them and brought the money from what was sold.
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave it to the missionaries. It was divided to each one as he had need.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph was among them. The missionaries called him Barnabas. His name means Son of Comfort. He was from the family group of Levi and from the country of Cyprus.
speaker: Narrator

text: He had some land which he sold and brought the money to the missionaries.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man by the name of Ananias and his wife, Sapphira, sold some land.
speaker: Narrator

text: He kept back part of the money for himself. His wife knew it also. The other part he took to the missionaries.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to Ananias, “Why did you let Satan fill your heart? He made you lie to the Holy Spirit. You kept back part of the money you got from your land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Was not the land yours before you sold it? After it was sold, you could have done what you wanted to do with the money. Why did you allow your heart to do this? You have lied to God, not to men.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Ananias heard these words, he fell down dead. Much fear came on all those who heard what was done.
speaker: Narrator

text: The young men got up and covered his body and carried him out and buried him.
speaker: Narrator

text: About three hours later his wife came in. She did not know what had happened.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to her, “Tell me, did you sell the land for this amount of money?” She said, “Yes.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter said to her, “How could you two have talked together about lying to the Holy Spirit? See! Those who buried your husband are standing at the door and they will carry you out also.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At once she fell down at his feet and died. When the young men came in, they found that she was dead. They took her out and buried her beside her husband.
speaker: Narrator

text: Much fear came on all the church and on all who heard it.
speaker: Narrator

text: The missionaries did many powerful works among the people. They gathered together on Solomon’s Porch.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one from outside their own group came in with them because they were afraid. But those outside the church had respect for the followers.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many more men and women put their trust in Christ and were added to the group.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought the sick people and laid them on the streets hoping that if Peter walked by, his shadow would fall on some of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many people went into Jerusalem from towns nearby. They took with them their sick people and all who were troubled with demons. All of them were healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The head religious leader heard this. Some of the religious group who believe no one will be raised from the dead also heard of the people being healed. They became very jealous.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took hold of the missionaries and put them in prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: An angel of the Lord opened the doors of the prison in the night and let them out. The angel said to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go, stand where you have been standing in the house of God. Keep on telling the people about this new life.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter and John heard this, they went in the house of God early in the morning and began to teach. When the head religious leader and those with him had come, they gathered the men of the court and the leaders of the Jews together. Then they sent to have the missionaries brought to them from the prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the soldiers got there, they did not find them in prison. They went back and told the court.
speaker: Narrator

text: The soldiers said, “We found the door of the prison locked and the soldiers watching the doors. When we opened the door, we found no one inside.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the religious leaders and the leader of the house of God heard this, they were much troubled as to what might happen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then someone came and told them, “The men you put in prison are now standing in the house of God and teaching the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The leader of the house of God took his men and got them. They did not hurt the missionaries because they were afraid the people would throw stones at them.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought the missionaries in and made them stand in front of the court. The head religious leader said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “We told you not to teach about Christ! See! You are spreading this teaching over all Jerusalem. Now you are making it look as if we are guilty of killing this Man.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter and the missionaries said, “We must obey God instead of men!
speaker: Narrator

text: The God of our early fathers raised up Jesus, the One you killed and nailed to a cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: God raised this Man to His own right side as a leader and as the One Who saves from the punishment of sin. He makes it possible for the Jews to be sorry for their sins. Then they can turn from them and be forgiven.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have seen these things and are telling about them. The Holy Spirit makes these things known also. God gives His Spirit to those who obey Him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The religious leaders became angry when they heard this. They planned to kill the missionaries.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gamaliel was a man of the religious leaders’ court. He was a proud religious law-keeper and a teacher of the Law. He was respected by all the people. He stood up and said that the missionaries should be sent outside for a short time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Gamaliel said to the court, “Jewish men, be careful what you plan to do with these men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember that many years ago a man called Theudas made himself out to be someone great. He had about 400 followers. He was killed. His followers were divided and nothing came of his teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: After him, Judas of the country of Galilee gathered many followers. It was the time for every person to have his name written in the books of the nation. This Judas was killed also. All his followers were divided and went away.
speaker: Narrator

text: I say to you now, stay away from these men and leave them alone. If this teaching and work is from men, it will come to nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: If it is from God, you will not be able to stop it. You may even find yourselves fighting against God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The court agreed with Gamaliel. So they called the missionaries in and beat them. They told them they must not speak in the name of Jesus. Then they were sent away.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the missionaries went away from the court happy that they could suffer shame because of His Name.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every day in the house of God and in the homes, they kept teaching and preaching about Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days the group of followers was getting larger. Greek-speaking Jews in the group complained against the Jews living in the country around Jerusalem. The Greek-speaking Jews said that their women whose husbands had died were not taken care of when the food was given out each day.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the twelve missionaries called a meeting of the many followers and said, “It is not right that we should give up preaching the Word of God to hand out food.
speaker: Narrator

text: Brothers, choose from among you seven men who are respected and who are full of the Holy Spirit and wisdom. We will have them take care of this work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then we will use all of our time to pray and to teach the Word of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These words pleased all of them. They chose Stephen who was a man full of faith and full of the Holy Spirit. They also chose Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas and Nicholas of Antioch who had become a Jew.
speaker: Narrator

text: These men were taken to the missionaries. After praying, the missionaries laid their hands on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Word of God spread further. The group of followers became much larger in Jerusalem. Many of the religious leaders believed in the faith of the Christians.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stephen was a man full of faith and power. He did many great things among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: But some men came from their place of worship who were known as the Free people. They started to argue with Stephen. These men were from the countries of Cyrene and Alexandria and Cilicia and Asia.
speaker: Narrator

text: Stephen spoke with wisdom and power given by the Holy Spirit. They were not able to say anything against what he said.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they told other men to say, “We have heard him say things against Moses and God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: In this way they got the people talking against Stephen. The leaders of the people and the teachers of the Law came and took him to the religious leaders’ court.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people were told to lie and say, “This man keeps on talking against this place of worship and the Law of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have heard him say, ‘Jesus of Nazareth is going to pull down this place. He is going to change what Moses taught us.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: The men sitting in the religious leaders’ court were looking at Stephen. They all saw that his face looked like the face of an angel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The head religious leader asked Stephen, “Are these things true?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Stephen said, “My brothers and fathers, listen to me. The great God showed Himself to our early father Abraham while he lived in the country of Mesopotamia. This was before he moved to the country of Haran.
speaker: Narrator

text: God said to him, ‘Leave your family and this land where you were born. Go to a land that I will show you.’
speaker: Narrator

text: He went from the land of the Chaldeans and lived in Haran. After his father died, he came to this country where you now live.
speaker: Narrator

text: God did not give him any land to own, not even enough to put his feet on. But He promised that the land would be his and his children’s after him. At that time he had no children.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what God said, ‘Your children’s children will be living in a strange land. They will live there 400 years. They will be made to work without pay and will suffer many hard things.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will say to that nation that it is guilty for holding them and making them work without pay. After that they will go free. They will leave that country and worship Me in this place.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “He made a promise with Abraham. It was kept by a religious act of becoming a Jew. Abraham had a son, Isaac. On the eighth day Abraham took Isaac and had this religious act done to him. Isaac was the father of Jacob. Jacob was the father of our twelve early fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The sons of Jacob sold Joseph to people from the country of Egypt because they were jealous of him. But God was with Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: He helped him in all his troubles. He gave him wisdom and favor with Pharaoh, the king of Egypt. This king made Joseph leader over Egypt and over all the king’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The time came when there was no food to eat in all the land of Egypt and Canaan. The people suffered much. Our early fathers were not able to get food.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jacob heard there was food in Egypt. He sent our early fathers there the first time.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The second time they went to the country of Egypt, Joseph made himself known to his brothers. The family of Joseph became known to Pharaoh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joseph asked his father Jacob and all his family to come. There were seventy-five people in the family.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jacob moved down to Egypt and died there. Our early fathers died there also.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were brought back to the city of Shechem where they were buried. Abraham paid money for the grave from the sons of Hamor in Shechem.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The promise God had given Abraham was about to happen. At this time many more of our people were in the country of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then another man became king in Egypt. He was a king who did not know Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was hard on our people and nation. He worked against our early fathers. He made them put their babies outside so they would die.
speaker: Narrator

text: “At that time Moses was born. He was beautiful in God’s sight. He was fed in his father’s house for three months.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he was put outside. Pharaoh’s daughter took him and cared for him as her own son.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses was taught in all the wisdom of the Egyptians. He became a powerful man in words and in the things he did.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he was forty years old, he thought he should visit his brothers, the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: He saw one of the Jews being hurt. Moses helped the Jew and killed the man from Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: He thought his people would understand. He thought they knew God would let them go free by his help. But the people did not understand.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The next day Moses came to some Jews who were fighting. He tried to get them to stop. Moses said to the Jews, ‘Sirs, you are brothers. Why do you hurt each other?’
speaker: Narrator

text: One was beating his neighbor. He pushed Moses away and said, ‘Who made you a leader over us? Who said you could say who is guilty?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you want to kill me as you killed the man from Egypt yesterday?’
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses heard that, he went as fast as he could to the country of Midian where he was a stranger. While he was there, he became the father of two sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forty years passed and Moses was near Mount Sinai where no people live. There he saw an angel in the fire of a burning bush.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was surprised and wondered when he saw it. He went up close to see it better. Then he heard the voice of the Lord speak to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘I am the God of your fathers, the God of Abraham and of Isaac and of Jacob.’ Moses shook! He was so afraid he did not look at the bush.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then the Lord said to him, ‘Take your shoes off your feet! The place where you are standing is holy ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have seen My people suffer in the country of Egypt and I have heard their cries. I have come down to let them go free. So come now, I will send you back to Egypt.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “The people had put Moses aside. They said, ‘Who made you a leader over us? Who said you are the one to say what is right or wrong?’ But God made this man a leader. Moses was the one who brought them out of the country of Egypt. This was done by the help of the angel who was in the burning bush.
speaker: Narrator

text: This man led them. He did powerful works in Egypt and at the Red Sea. For forty years he led them in the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Moses said to the Jews, ‘God will give you one who speaks for Him like me from among your brothers.’
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the man who was with the Jewish nation in the desert. The angel talked to him on Mount Sinai. Moses told it to our early fathers. He also received the living Words of God to give to us.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Our early fathers would not listen to him. They did not obey him. In their hearts they wanted to go back to the country of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to Aaron, ‘Make us gods to go before us. We do not know what has happened to this Moses who led us out of Egypt.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “In those days they made a calf of gold. They put gifts down in front of their god in worship. They were happy with what they had made with their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God turned from them and let them worship the stars of heaven. This is written in the book of the early preachers, ‘Nation of Jews, was it to Me you gave gifts of sheep and cattle on the altar for forty years in the desert?
speaker: Narrator

text: No, you set up the tent to worship the god of Molock and the star of your god Rompha. You made gods to worship them. I will carry you away to the other side of the country of Babylon.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Our early fathers had the tent to worship in. They used it in the desert. God told Moses to make it like the plan which he had seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was received by our early fathers. They brought it here when they won the wars with the people who were not Jews. It was when Joshua was our leader. God made those people leave as our early fathers took the land. The tent was here until the time of David.
speaker: Narrator

text: David pleased God and wanted to build a house for worship for the God of Jacob.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Solomon was the one who built the house of God for Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Most High does not live in buildings made by hands. The early preacher said,
speaker: Narrator

text: ’Heaven is the place where I sit and the earth is the place where I rest My feet. What house will you build Me?’ says the Lord. ‘Or what is My place of rest?
speaker: Narrator

text: Did not My hands make all these things?’
speaker: Narrator

text: “You have hard hearts and ears that will not listen to me! You are always working against the Holy Spirit. Your early fathers did. You do too.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which of the early preachers was not beaten and hurt by your early fathers? They killed those who told of the coming of the One Right with God. Now you have handed Him over and killed Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: You had the Law given to you by angels. Yet you have not kept it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews and religious leaders listened to Stephen. Then they became angry and began to grind their teeth at him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was filled with the Holy Spirit. As he looked up to heaven, he saw the shining-greatness of God and Jesus standing at the right side of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “See! I see heaven open and the Son of Man standing at the right side of God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: They cried out with loud voices. They put their hands over their ears and they all pushed on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they took him out of the city and threw stones at him. The men who were throwing the stones laid their coats down in front of a young man named Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: While they threw stones at Stephen, he prayed, “Lord Jesus, receive my spirit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After that he fell on his knees and cried out with a loud voice, “Lord, do not hold this sin against them.” When he had said this, he died.
speaker: Narrator

text: Saul thought it was all right that Stephen was killed. On that day people started to work very hard against the church in Jerusalem. All the followers, except the missionaries, were made to leave. They went to parts of the countries of Judea and Samaria.
speaker: Narrator

text: Good men put Stephen in a grave. There was much sorrow because of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: During this time Saul was making it very hard for the church. He went into every house of the followers of Jesus and took men and women and put them in prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who had been made to go to other places preached the Word as they went.
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip went down to a city in Samaria and preached about Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people all listened to what Philip said. As they listened, they watched him do powerful works.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were many people who had demons in their bodies. The demons cried with loud voices when they went out of the people. Many of the people could not move their bodies or arms and legs. They were all healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was much joy in that city.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man by the name of Simon had done witchcraft there. The people of Samaria were surprised at the things he did. He pretended that he was a great man.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the people watched and listened to him. They said, “This man must be that great power of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They kept running after him. For a long time he fooled them with his witchcraft.
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip told the Good News of the holy nation of God and of Jesus Christ. Both men and women put their trust in Christ and were baptized.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even Simon believed in Christ and was baptized. He went along with Philip everywhere. He was surprised when he saw the powerful works that were being done.
speaker: Narrator

text: The missionaries in Jerusalem heard that the people of Samaria had received the Word of God. They sent Peter and John to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter and John got there, they prayed that the new followers might receive the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: He had not yet come on any of them. They had only been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: They laid their hands on them and the followers received the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Simon saw that the Holy Spirit was given when the missionaries laid their hands on the people, he wanted to give money to the missionaries.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “Let me also have this power. Then I can give the Holy Spirit to anyone I lay my hands on.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to him, “May your money be destroyed with you because you thought you could buy the gift of God with money!
speaker: Narrator

text: You have no part or place in this work. Your heart is not right in God’s sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must be sorry for this sin of yours and turn from it. Pray to the Lord that He will forgive you for having such a thought in your heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: I see that you are full of jealousy and chained by your sin.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon said, “Pray to the Lord for me that nothing you have said will come to me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter and John went back to Jerusalem after telling what they had seen and heard. They had preached the Word of the Lord also. On the way they preached the Good News in many other towns in the country of Samaria.
speaker: Narrator

text: An angel of the Lord spoke to Philip saying, “Get up and go south. Take the road that goes down from Jerusalem to the country of Gaza. It goes through the desert.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip got up and went. A man from the country of Ethiopia had come to Jerusalem to worship. He had been made so he could not have children. He cared for all the riches that belonged to Candace who was Queen of Ethiopia.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he was going back home, he was sitting in his wagon reading about the early preacher Isaiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Holy Spirit said to Philip, “Go over to that wagon and get on it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip ran up to him. He saw that the man from Ethiopia was reading from the writings of the early preacher Isaiah and said, “Do you understand what you are reading?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The man from Ethiopia said, “How can I, unless someone teaches me?” Then he asked Philip to come up and sit beside him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was reading the part in the Holy Writings which says He was taken like a lamb to be put to death. A sheep does not make a sound while its wool is cut. So He made no sound.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one listened to Him because of His shame. Who will tell the story of His day? For His life was taken away from the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The man from Ethiopia said to Philip, “Who is the early preacher talking about, himself, or someone else?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Philip started with this part of the Holy Writings and preached the Good News of Jesus to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As they went on their way, they came to some water. The man from Ethiopia said, “See! Here is water. What is to stop me from being baptized?”
speaker: Narrator

text: (Philip said, “If you believe with all your heart, you may.” The man said, “I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.”)
speaker: Narrator

text: He stopped the wagon. Then both Philip and the man from Ethiopia went down into the water and Philip baptized him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they came up out of the water, the Holy Spirit took Philip away. The man from Ethiopia did not see Philip again. He went on his way full of joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip found himself at the city of Azotus. Then Philip went through all the towns as far as the city of Caesarea preaching the Good News at each place.
speaker: Narrator

text: Saul was still talking much about how he would like to kill the followers of the Lord. He went to the head religious leader.
speaker: Narrator

text: He asked for letters to be written to the Jewish places of worship in the city of Damascus. The letters were to say that if he found any men or women following the Way of Christ he might bring them to Jerusalem in chains.
speaker: Narrator

text: He went on his way until he came near Damascus. All at once he saw a light from heaven shining around him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He fell to the ground. Then he heard a voice say, “Saul, Saul, why are you working so hard against Me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Saul answered, “Who are You, Lord?” He said, “I am Jesus, the One Whom you are working against. You hurt yourself by trying to hurt Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Saul was shaken and surprised. Then he said, “What do You want me to do, Lord?” The Lord said to him, “Get up! Go into the city and you will be told what to do.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Those with Saul were not able to say anything. They heard a voice but saw no one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Saul got up from the ground. When he opened his eyes, he saw nothing. They took him by the hand and led him to Damascus.
speaker: Narrator

text: He could not see for three days. During that time he did not eat or drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: In Damascus there was a follower by the name of Ananias. The Lord showed him in a dream what He wanted him to see. He said, “Ananias!” And Ananias answered, “Yes, Lord, I am here.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said, “Get up! Go over to Straight Street to Judas’ house and ask for a man from the city of Tarsus. His name is Saul. You will find him praying there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Saul has seen a man called Ananias in a dream. He is to come and put his hands on Saul so he might see again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Ananias said, “But Lord, many people have told me about this man. He is the reason many of Your followers in Jerusalem have had to suffer much.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came here with the right and the power from the head religious leaders to put everyone in chains who call on Your name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to him, “Go! This man is the one I have chosen to carry My name among the people who are not Jews and to their kings and to Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will show him how much he will have to suffer because of Me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Ananias went to that house. He put his hands on Saul and said, “Brother Saul, the Lord Jesus has sent me to you. You saw the Lord along the road as you came here. The Lord has sent me so you might be able to see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit.”
speaker: Narrator

text: At once something like a covering fell from the eyes of Saul and he could see. He got up and was baptized.
speaker: Narrator

text: After that he ate some food and received strength. For some days he stayed with the followers in Damascus.
speaker: Narrator

text: At once Saul began to preach in the Jewish places of worship that Jesus is the Son of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who heard him were surprised and wondered. They said, “This is the man who beat and killed the followers in Jerusalem. He came here to tie the followers in chains and take them to the head religious leaders.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Saul kept on growing in power. The Jews living in Damascus wondered about Saul’s preaching. He was proving that Jesus was the Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: After some days the Jews talked together and made plans how they might kill Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: He heard of their plans. Day and night they watched for him at the city gates to kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the followers helped him get away at night. They let him down over the wall in a basket.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Saul had come to Jerusalem, he tried to join the followers. But they were afraid of him. They did not believe he was a true follower of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Barnabas took him to the missionaries. He told them that Saul had seen the Lord on the road. He told them also how the Lord had spoken to Saul and how he had preached without fear in Damascus in the name of Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: After that he was with them going in and out of Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: He preached without fear in the name of the Lord. He talked and argued with the Jews who spoke the Greek language. They kept trying to kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the followers heard this, they took him down to the city of Caesarea. From there they sent him to the city of Tarsus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the church through all the countries of Judea and Galilee and Samaria had peace for awhile. The church was made strong and it was given comfort by the Holy Spirit. It honored the Lord. More people were added to the church.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter was visiting all parts of the country, he came to the faithful followers who were living in the city of Lydda.
speaker: Narrator

text: A man there named Aeneas could not move his body. He had been in bed eight years.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to him, “Aeneas, Jesus Christ heals you. Get up and roll up your bed.” He got up at once.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the people who lived in Lydda and in the city of Sharon saw Aeneas and they turned to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: A woman who was a follower lived in the city of Joppa. Her name was Tabitha, or Dorcas. She did many good things and many acts of kindness.
speaker: Narrator

text: One day she became sick and died. After they had washed her body, they laid her in a room on the second floor.
speaker: Narrator

text: The city of Lydda was near Joppa. The followers heard that Peter was at Lydda and sent two men to ask him to come at once.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter went back with them. When he came, they took him to the room. All the women whose husbands had died were standing around crying. They were showing the clothes Dorcas had made while she was with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter made them all leave the room. Then he got down on his knees and prayed. He turned to her body and said, “Tabitha, get up!” She opened her eyes and looked at Peter and sat up.
speaker: Narrator

text: He took her by the hand and lifted her up. Then he called in the faithful followers and the women whose husbands had died. He gave her to them, a living person.
speaker: Narrator

text: News of this went through all Joppa. Many people put their trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, Peter stayed in Joppa many days in the house of Simon who worked with leather.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a man in the city of Caesarea by the name of Cornelius. He was a captain of an Italian group of the army.
speaker: Narrator

text: He and his family were good people and honored God. He gave much money to the people and prayed always to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: One afternoon about three o’clock he saw in a dream what God wanted him to see. An angel of God came to him and said, “Cornelius.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He was afraid as he looked at the angel. He said, “What is it, Lord?” The angel said, “Your prayers and your gifts of money have gone up to God. He has remembered them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Send some men to the city of Joppa and ask Simon Peter to come here.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is living with Simon, the man who works with leather. His house is by the sea-shore. He will tell you what you must do.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel left him. Then Cornelius called two of his servants and a religious soldier who took care of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He told what had happened. Then he sent them to Joppa.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day they went on their way. About noon they were coming near the town. At this time Peter went up on the roof to pray.
speaker: Narrator

text: He became very hungry and wanted something to eat. While they were getting food ready to eat, he saw in a dream things God wanted him to see.
speaker: Narrator

text: He saw heaven open up and something like a large linen cloth being let down to earth by the four corners.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the cloth were all kinds of four-footed animals and snakes of the earth and birds of the sky.
speaker: Narrator

text: A voice came to him, “Get up, Peter, kill something and eat it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said, “No, Lord! I have never eaten anything that our Law says is unclean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice said the second time, “What God has made clean you must not say is unclean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This happened three times. Then it was taken back to heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter thought about the meaning of the dream. The men that Cornelius had sent came. They were standing by the gate asking about Simon’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: They called to ask if Simon Peter was staying there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter was still thinking about the dream when the Holy Spirit said to him, “See, three men are looking for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Get up. Go down and go with them. Do not doubt if you should go, because I sent them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter went down to the men who had been sent by Cornelius. He said, “I am the one you are looking for. Why have you come?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “Cornelius sent us. He is a captain and a good man and he honors God. The whole Jewish nation can say this is true. An angel from God told him to send for you. He asks you to come to his house. He wants to hear what you have to say.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter asked them to come in and stay with him for the night. The next day he went with them. Some of the brothers from Joppa went along.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day they came to Caesarea. Cornelius was looking for them. He had gathered all his family and close friends at his house.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter came, Cornelius got down at his feet and worshiped him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Peter raised him up and said, “Get up! I am just a man like you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As Peter spoke with Cornelius, he went into the house and found a large group of people gathered together.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to them, “You know it is against our Law for a Jew to visit a person of another nation. But God has shown me I should not say that any man is unclean.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason I came as soon as you sent for me. But I want to ask you why you sent for me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Cornelius said, “Four days ago at three o’clock in the afternoon I was praying here in my house. All at once, I saw a man standing in front of me. He had on bright clothes.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to me, ‘Cornelius, God has heard your prayers and has remembered your gifts of love.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must send to Joppa and ask Simon Peter to come here. He is staying at the house of Simon, the man who works with leather. His house is by the sea-shore.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I sent for you at once. You have done well to come. We are all here and God is with us. We are ready to hear whatever the Lord has told you to say.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter said, “I can see, for sure, that God does not respect one person more than another.
speaker: Narrator

text: He is pleased with any man in any nation who honors Him and does what is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has sent His Word to the Jews. He told them the Good News of peace through Jesus Christ. Jesus is Lord of All.
speaker: Narrator

text: You know the story yourselves. It was told in all the country of Judea. It began in the country of Galilee after the preaching of John the Baptist.
speaker: Narrator

text: God gave Jesus of Nazareth the Holy Spirit and power. He went around doing good and healing all who were troubled by the devil because God was with Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have seen and heard everything He did in the land of the Jews and in Jerusalem. And yet they killed Him by nailing Him to a cross.
speaker: Narrator

text: God raised Him to life on the third day and made Him to be seen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not all the people saw Him but those who were chosen to see Him. We saw Him. We ate and drank with Him after He was raised from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: He told us to preach to the people and tell them that God gave Christ the right to be the One Who says who is guilty of the living and the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the early preachers spoke of this. Everyone who puts his trust in Christ will have his sins forgiven through His name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: While Peter was speaking, the Holy Spirit came on all who were hearing his words.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jewish followers who had come along with Peter were surprised and wondered because the gift of the Holy Spirit was also given to the people who were not Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: They heard them speak in special sounds and give thanks to God. Then Peter said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Will anyone say that these people may not be baptized? They have received the Holy Spirit just as we have.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He gave the word that they should be baptized in the name of the Lord. Then they asked Peter to stay with them for some days.
speaker: Narrator

text: The missionaries and followers who were in the country of Judea heard that the people who were not Jews also had received the Word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter went up to Jerusalem, the Jewish followers argued with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “Why did you visit those people who are not Jews and eat with them?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter began to tell all that had happened from the beginning to the end. He said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “While I was praying in the city of Joppa, I saw in a dream something coming down from heaven. It was like a large linen cloth let down by the four corners until it came to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: As I looked at it, I saw four-footed animals and snakes of the earth and birds of the sky.
speaker: Narrator

text: I heard a voice saying to me, ‘Get up, Peter, kill something and eat it.’
speaker: Narrator

text: But I said, ‘No, Lord! Nothing that is unclean has ever gone into my mouth.’
speaker: Narrator

text: The voice from heaven said the second time, ‘What God has made clean you must not say is unclean.’
speaker: Narrator

text: This happened three times and then it was taken up again to heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Three men had already come to the house where I was staying. They had been sent to me from the city of Caesarea.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Holy Spirit told me to go with them and not doubt about going. These six men also went with me to this man’s house.
speaker: Narrator

text: He told us how he had seen an angel in his own home. The angel had stood in front of him and said, ‘Send men to Joppa to ask for Simon Peter.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will tell you and all your family how you can be saved from the punishment of sin.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “As I began to talk to them, the Holy Spirit came down on them just as He did on us at the beginning.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I remembered the Lord had said, ‘John baptized with water but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit.’
speaker: Narrator

text: If God gave to them the same gift He gave to us after we put our trust in the Lord Jesus Christ, how could I stand against God?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard these words, they said nothing more. They thanked God, saying, “Then God has given life also to the people who are not Jews. They have this new life by being sorry for their sins and turning from them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who went different places because of the trouble that started over Stephen had gone as far as the cities of Phoenicia and Cyprus and Antioch. They had preached the Word, but only to the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the men from Cyprus and Cyrene returned to Antioch. They preached the Good News of Jesus Christ to the Greek people there.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord gave them power. Many people put their trust in the Lord and turned to Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The news of this came to the church in Jerusalem. They sent Barnabas to Antioch.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he got there and saw how good God had been to them, he was full of joy. He told them to be true and faithful to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Barnabas was a good man and full of the Holy Spirit and faith. And many people became followers of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: From there Barnabas went on to the city of Tarsus to look for Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he found Saul, he brought him back with him to Antioch. For a year they taught many people in the church. The followers were first called Christians in Antioch.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time some men who preached God’s Word came to Antioch and told what was going to happen. They were from Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: One of them was Agabus. The Holy Spirit told him to stand up and speak. He told them there would be very little food to eat over all the world. This happened when Claudius was leader of the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Christians agreed that each one should give what money he could to help the Christians living in Judea.
speaker: Narrator

text: They did this and sent it to the church leaders with Barnabas and Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time King Herod used his power to make it hard for the Christians in the church.
speaker: Narrator

text: He killed James, the brother of John, with a sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he saw that it made the Jews happy, he took hold of Peter also. This was during the special religious gathering to remember how the Jews left Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Herod took Peter and put him in prison and had sixteen soldiers watch him. After the special religious gathering was over, he planned to bring Peter out to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Peter was held in prison. But the church kept praying to God for him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The night before Herod was to bring him out for his trial, Peter was sleeping between two soldiers. He was tied with two chains. Soldiers stood by the door and watched the prison.
speaker: Narrator

text: All at once an angel of the Lord was seen standing beside him. A light shone in the building. The angel hit Peter on the side and said, “Get up!” Then the chains fell off his hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel said, “Put on your belt and shoes!” He did. The angel said to Peter, “Put on your coat and follow me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter followed him out. He was not sure what was happening as the angel helped him. He thought it was a dream.
speaker: Narrator

text: They passed one soldier, then another one. They came to the big iron door that leads to the city and it opened by itself and they went through. As soon as they had gone up one street, the angel left him.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Peter began to see what was happening, he said to himself, “Now I am sure the Lord has sent His angel and has taken me out of the hands of Herod. He has taken me also from all the things the Jews wanted to do to me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After thinking about all this, he went to Mary’s house. She was the mother of John Mark. Many Christians were gathered there praying.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter knocked at the gate, a girl named Rhoda went to see who it was.
speaker: Narrator

text: She knew Peter’s voice, but in her joy she forgot to open the gate. She ran in and told them that Peter was standing outside the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to her, “You are crazy.” But she said again that it was so. They kept saying, “It is his angel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter kept knocking. When they opened the gate and saw him, they were surprised and wondered about it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He raised his hand and told them not to talk but to listen to him. He told them how the Lord had brought him out of prison. He said, “Tell all these things to James and to the other Christian brothers.” Then he went to another place.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the morning the soldiers were very troubled about what had happened to Peter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Herod looked for him but could not find him. He asked the soldiers who watched the prison about Peter. Herod said that the soldiers must be killed because Peter got away. Then Herod went down from the country of Judea to the city of Caesarea to stay for awhile.
speaker: Narrator

text: Herod was very angry with the people of the cities of Tyre and Sidon. They went to him and asked for peace to be made between them and the king. They asked this because their country got food from the king’s country. The people made friends with Blastus, the king’s helper.
speaker: Narrator

text: A day was set aside. On that day Herod put on purple clothes a king wears. He sat on his throne and spoke to the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: They all started to speak with a loud voice, “This is the voice of a god, not of a man.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The angel of the Lord knocked him down because he did not give honor to God. He was eaten by worms and died.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Word of God was heard by many people and went into more places.
speaker: Narrator

text: Saul and Barnabas went back to Jerusalem after they had finished their work. They took John Mark with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the church in the city of Antioch there were preachers and teachers. They were Barnabas, Simeon Niger, Lucius of the country of Cyrene, Manaen of Herod’s family, and Saul.
speaker: Narrator

text: While they were worshiping the Lord and eating no food so they could pray better, the Holy Spirit said, “Let Barnabas and Saul be given to Me for the work I have called them to.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These preachers and teachers went without food during that time and prayed. Then they laid their hands on Barnabas and Saul and sent them away.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were sent by the Holy Spirit to the city of Seleucia. From there they went by ship to the island of Cyprus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they went to shore at the city of Salamis, they preached the Word of God in the Jewish place of worship. John Mark was with them as their helper.
speaker: Narrator

text: They went over Cyprus as far as the city of Paphos. While there, they found a Jew who did witchcraft. He was a false preacher named Barjesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sergius Paulus was the leader of the country and a man who knew much. Barjesus was with Sergius Paulus. Sergius Paulus asked Barnabas and Saul to come to him so he might hear the Word of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Elymas (as he called himself), the man who did witchcraft, worked against Barnabas and Saul. He tried to keep the leader of the country from putting his trust in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Saul, whose other name was Paul, was full of the Holy Spirit. He looked at Elymas.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Saul said, “You false preacher and trouble-maker! You son of the devil! You hate what is right! Will you always be turning people from the right ways of the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text: And now look! The hand of the Lord is on you. You will become blind. For a time you will not be able to see the sun.” At once it became dark to Elymas, and he could not see. He asked people to take him by the hand to lead him from place to place.
speaker: Narrator

text: The leader of the country put his trust in the Lord because he saw what had happened. He was surprised and wondered about the teaching of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Paul and those with him went by ship from Paphos to the city of Perga in the country of Pamphylia. John Mark did not go with them but went back to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Perga they went on to the city of Antioch in the country of Pisidia. On the Day of Rest they went into the Jewish place of worship and sat down.
speaker: Narrator

text: After the leaders had read from the Jewish Law and the writings of the early preachers, they sent to them saying, “Brothers, if you have any word of comfort and help for the people, say it now.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Paul got up. He raised his hand and said, “Jewish men and you who honor God, listen!
speaker: Narrator

text: The God of the Jews chose our early fathers and made them a great people during the time they lived in the land of Egypt. With a strong hand He took them out from there.
speaker: Narrator

text: For about forty years He took care of them in the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text: He destroyed the people of seven nations in the land of Canaan. Then He divided the land and gave it to them as their own.
speaker: Narrator

text: For about 450 years He let them have special leaders. They had these leaders until the time of Samuel.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then they wanted a king. God gave them Saul who was the son of Kish from the family group of Benjamin. He was king forty years.
speaker: Narrator

text: When God took Saul as king from them, He made David to be their king. He said, ‘David, Jesse’s son, will please My heart. He will do all I want done.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “From this man’s family, God gave to the Jews the One Who saves from the punishment of sin as He had promised. He is Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Before Jesus came, John had preached to all the Jews that they should be baptized because they were sorry for their sins and turned from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When John was near the end of his work, he asked, ‘Who do you think I am? I am not the Christ. No, but He is coming later and I am not good enough to get down and help Him take off His shoes!’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Men and brothers, sons of the family of Abraham, and all of you who honor God, listen! This news of being able to be saved from the punishment of sin has been sent to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people of Jerusalem and their leaders did not know Him. They did not understand the words from the early preachers. These words were read to them every Day of Rest. But they did the very thing the early preachers had said they would do by handing Him over to die.
speaker: Narrator

text: They could find no reason that He should die, but they asked Pilate to have Him killed.
speaker: Narrator

text: When everything was done that had been written about Him, they took Him down from the cross and laid Him in a grave.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God raised Him from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: For many days He was seen by those who came up with Him from Galilee to Jerusalem. These are the ones who tell the people about Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “We bring you the Good News about the promise made to our early fathers.
speaker: Narrator

text: God has finished this for us who are their children. He did this by raising Jesus from the dead. It is written in the second Psalm, ‘You are My Son. Today I have become Your Father.’
speaker: Narrator

text: God proved that Jesus was His Son by raising Him from the dead. He will never die again. He has said, ‘I will complete the promises made to David.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “In another Psalm He says, ‘You will not allow Your Holy One to go back to dust!’
speaker: Narrator

text: David was a good leader for the people of his day. He did what God wanted. Then he died and was put into a grave close to his father’s grave. His body went back to dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God raised this One (Christ) to life. He did not go back to dust.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Men and brothers, listen to this. You may be forgiven of your sins by this One I am telling you about.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone who puts his trust in Christ will be made right with God. You will be made free from those things the Law of Moses could not make you free from.
speaker: Narrator

text: But look out! The writings of the early preachers tell of many things that you do not want to happen to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Listen, you who doubt and laugh at the truth will die. I will do a work during your days. It will be a work that you will not believe even if someone tells you about it.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: As Paul and Barnabas went out of the Jewish place of worship, the people asked them to talk about these things on the next Day of Rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people went from the place of worship. Many Jews and others who had become Jews followed Paul and Barnabas as they talked to the Jews. They told them to keep on trusting in the loving-favor of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Almost all of the people of the town came to hear the Word of God on the next Day of Rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews were filled with jealousy when they saw so many people. They spoke against the things Paul said by saying he was wrong. They also spoke against God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Paul and Barnabas said to the people in plain words, “We must preach the Word of God to you first. But because you put it aside, you are not good enough for life that lasts forever. So we will go to the people who are not Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord gave us a work to do. He said, ‘You are to be a light to the people who are not Jews. You are to preach so that men over all the earth can be saved from the punishment of their sins.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: The people who were not Jews were glad when they heard this. They were thankful for the Word of God. Those who were chosen for life that lasts forever believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Word of God was preached over all that land.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews worked on the feelings of the women who were religious and respected. They worked on the leading men of the city also. They worked against Paul and Barnabas and made them leave their city.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Paul and Barnabas shook the dust off from their feet against them and went to the city of Iconium.
speaker: Narrator

text: The missionaries were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the city of Iconium, Paul and Barnabas went into the Jewish place of worship. They preached with power and many people became Christians. These people were Jews and Greeks.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Jews who did not want to believe worked against those who were not Jews. They made them turn against the Christians.
speaker: Narrator

text: Paul and Barnabas stayed there a long time preaching with the strength the Lord gave. God helped them to do powerful works when they preached which showed He was with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people of the city were divided. Some were on the side of the Jews. Some were on the side of the missionaries.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the people and the leaders tried to hurt them and throw stones at them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Paul and Barnabas heard this, they got away and went to the cities of Lystra and Derbe in Lycaonia and to the country close by.
speaker: Narrator

text: They stayed there and kept on preaching the Good News.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a man in Lystra who had never walked from the time he was born.
speaker: Narrator

text: This man listened as Paul spoke. Paul watched him. He saw that the man believed he could be healed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Calling to him with a loud voice, Paul said, “Stand up on your feet!” The man jumped up and walked around.
speaker: Narrator

text: The people saw what Paul did. They called with loud voices in the language of the people of Lycaonia, “The gods have become like men and have come down to us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said that Barnabas was Jupiter. Paul was called Mercury because he spoke more than Barnabas.
speaker: Narrator

text: The god of Jupiter was in a building near the gate leading into the city. The religious leader of that place brought cattle and flowers to the gate. He and many other people wanted to burn these as gifts in an act of worship to Paul and Barnabas.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Paul and Barnabas heard this, they ran among the people. They tore their clothes and cried out,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Why are you doing this? We are only men with feelings like yours. We preach the Good News that you should turn from these empty things to the living God. He made the heavens and the earth and the sea and everything in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Long ago He allowed all people to live the way they wanted to.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even then God did not leave you without something to see of Him. He did good. He gave you rain from heaven and much food. He made you happy.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Even with these words it was hard for Paul and Barnabas to keep the people from burning cattle in an act of worship to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: By this time some Jews from the cities of Antioch and Iconium came. They turned the minds of the people against Paul and Barnabas and told them to throw stones at Paul. After they threw stones at him, they dragged him out of the city thinking he was dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the Christians gathered around Paul, he got up and went back into the city. The next day he went with Barnabas to Derbe.
speaker: Narrator

text: In that city they preached the Good News and taught many people. Then they returned to the cities of Lystra and Iconium and Antioch.
speaker: Narrator

text: In each city they helped the Christians to be strong and true to the faith. They told them, “We must suffer many hard things to get into the holy nation of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: In every church they chose leaders for them. They went without food during that time so they could pray better. Paul and Barnabas prayed for the leaders, giving them over to the Lord in Whom they believed.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had gone through the city of Pisidia, they came to the city of Pamphylia.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they preached the Good News in the city of Perga. After this they went down to the city of Attalia.
speaker: Narrator

text: From there they went by ship to Antioch where they had been given to the Lord for His work. The work of this trip was done.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they got there, they called the church together. They told them everything God had done for them. They told how God had opened the door for the people who were not Jews to have faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: They stayed there with the followers a long time.
speaker: Narrator
